render.tex: \title{Common Derivatives} Derivatives of powers, logarithmic \&trigonometric functions etc.

reason.tex:
%text You would encounter the following derivatives most frequently in your studies. The proofs are easy. But we will just give the result \textbf{Note: } In the table below, $\log x$ is actually \underline\text{$\log$ to the base $e$ } % \begin{align} \begin{tabular}{MM}
\hline f(x) & \frac{d}{dx}f(x) \\ \hline x^n,\, n\in\mathbb{R} & n\cdot x^{n-1} \\ \hline e^x & e^x \\ \hline a^x & \log a \cdot a^x \\ \hline \log x & \frac{1}{x} \\ \hline \sin x & \cos x \\ \hline \cos x & -\sin x \\ \hline \tan x & \sec^2 x \\ \hline \sin^{-1} x,\,x\in(-1,1) & \dfrac{1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}} \\ \hline \cos^{-1} x, \, x\in(-1,1) & -\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{1-x^2}} \\ \hline \tan^{-1} x & \dfrac{1}{1+x^2} \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{align} %text %
